result.execSummary:
The defendant Janice M. Mannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Janice M. Mannon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Janice M. Mannon was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Janice M. Mannon was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC re: term of probation
Count 1 & 3

Defendant Janice M. Mannon in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges in count 1 and count 3 and max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 & 3.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of count 1 & 3.  Upon motion of the State, court dismisses count 2.  VR complied with.  No VIS.  In 15CM11, Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation concurrent with 14CF34.  Conditions:  30 days in PCJ with work release com. 7/8/15 @ 10:00 a.m. concurrent with 14CF34; provide DNA sample, waive DNA surcharge on misdemeanor case, assess only on felony case; waive court costs due to unemployed; advised of appeal rights.
Defendant Janice M. Mannon in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties reached an agreement.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on July 27, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for June 30, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than May 14, 2015. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than May 14, 2015, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
9 . .... 
10.  Both parties shall be present with their client and ready to go on the record no later than 8:30 on the morning of trial. 
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Jury trial at 07-27-2015 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 06-30-2015 01:30 pm.
